見出し読み: ぶつにちあんこうもつもくろく
見出し読み_mod: ぶつにちあんこうもつもくろく
説明文: a catalogue, first compiled in 1320, of treasures in the Butsunichi'an, a sub-temple of Engakuji.  This one sub-temple held several hundred Chinese treasures, including not only portraits of Ch'an masters (chinsō) and samples of their calligraphy but also paintings attributed to MuCh'I, the Emperor Hui-tsung, and other Sung masters.
